result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
/Request to Adjourn the 10/10/22 plea/sentencing.

8:38 AM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Carroll advises that matter is settled, requesting an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  No objection by State.  Plea/sentencing adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Exhibits A & B

2:38 PM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Joseph Levin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony taken, exhibits marked.  Argument by both sides.  Court denies motion and accepts Defendant's Exhibits A & B.  Bond continues.  Plea/Sentencing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 8:30 am
Motion hearing on August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
To Suppress Evidence submitted by Atty Carroll
Copy of letter from DMV indicating validity of dealer plates submitted by Atty Carroll.

10:38 AM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request to adjourn plea/sentencing hearing approximately 30 days.  Attorney Carroll indicates matter will not be going to jury trial.  No objection from state.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
State's Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial
Staying Suspension Pending Judicial Review.  Faxed to DOT by JA.
Letter to Judge from Atty Miller Carroll
for Judicial Review - faxed to DMV on this date

08:34 AM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has requested a new jury trial date.  Defendant has no objection.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
indicating no objection to State's Motion To Adjourn submitted by Atty Carroll
State's Motion To Adjourn 6/7/22 Jury Trial
Felony OWI Expert Notice
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to Judge - Request Adjournment by Atty Carroll
Jury Trial

08:53 AM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Defendant requests 24/7 to be removed - device not charging, last OWI dated.  State objects, court will not remove.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:10 AM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE requests to address bond, remove the 24/7 program.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects.  The court will not amend bond.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:15.  Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed on 02-28-22

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 114287,
Payable Number: 316017,
Amount: $20.00

OWI(4TH)
CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

02:17 PM Defendant RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL in court, in custody.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RAYMOND EDWARD SEIDL appeared by video means.  Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  Advised of rights. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 2:21.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
